name: My Stars and Garters! Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Illinois.

	McCoy was born in Dunfee, Illinois. His parents, Norton and Edna, noticed that he had large hands and feet. In fact, they were roughly the size of a gorilla's!

questions.text: In addition to being a longtime member of the X-Men, Beast has also been a member of many other groups. Which team has he NOT been a member of?
questions.explanation:
The Trenchcoat Brigade.

	After growing blue fur and canine teeth, McCoy joined the Avengers, a group that is more socially accepted than the X-Men. It is in this team that he would form a lasting friendship with Wonder Man, Simon Williams.

questions.text: In the 73rd issue of "X-Men", Beast resolves to eat fewer Twinkies.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Several X-Men have favorite foods or beverages. For example, Nightcrawler and Wolverine both enjoy beer.

questions.text: While at the Elton Corporation, McCoy invented a serum that would give him blue fur as an unknown side-effect.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was during his tenure at the Brand Corporation that McCoy would develop this serum, originally used to give anyone mutant powers for a short period of time. Also, McCoy's fur was originally gray, not blue.

questions.text: This reporter was McCoy's girlfriend for a very long time.
questions.explanation:
Trish Tilby.

	Trish broke up with McCoy shortly after his secondary mutation, which caused him to take on feline features instead of ape-like ones. With this came heightened senses and increased ferocity.

questions.text: Which ally did Beast save from death by literally piecing her back together?
questions.explanation:
Emma Frost.

	Emma Frost was shot and turned to her diamond form, which quickly shattered. Once all of her pieces were carefully put back into place Jean Grey was able to fuse them back together and Emma was among the living once more.

questions.text: McCoy eventually cured the Legacy virus, which had been slowly killing mutants for a long time. Which X-Man died after injecting himself with the cure?
questions.explanation:
Colossus.

	The cure developed by Beast could only be released into the air after the first person to inject themselves with it died. Colossus made the ultimate sacrifice and gave his life before anybody else could die from the virus.

questions.text: In the Age of Apocalyspe timeline, what was Beast known as?
questions.explanation:
McCoy.

	This version of McCoy worked in Sinister's labs, and later escaped to the normal Marvel timeline, where he came to be known as Dark Beast. In the AoA timeline, he was known simply as McCoy.

questions.text: Beast is a playable character in both versions of "X-Men Legends" and the sequel "X-Men Legends II: Rise of Apocalypse" for the PlayStation 2.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Beast is a playable character in "X-Men Legends", but not the sequel; he only appeared as a playable character in the PSP version.

questions.text: Which actor played McCoy in the 2006 movie "X3: The Last Stand"?
questions.explanation:
Kelsey Grammer.

	Grammer is famous for his role of Frasier on the NBC sitcoms "Cheers" and "Frasier". He has also lent his voice to Sideshow Bob on Fox's "The Simpsons".
